input: Alice has 3 apples. Bob gives her 5 more apples. Then Charlie takes away 2 apples. Finally, Alice buys 4 more apples. How many apples does Alice have now?
A train leaves Station A at 9:00 AM traveling at 60 mph. Another train leaves Station B, which is 180 miles away, at 10:00 AM traveling toward Station A at 90 mph. At what time do the trains meet?
John is twice as old as Mary. Five years ago, John was three times as old as Mary. How old is Mary now?
A store sells notebooks for $3 each and pens for $2 each. Tom bought 4 notebooks and some pens for a total of $20. How many pens did Tom buy?
The sum of three consecutive even integers is 78. What is the largest of these integers?
A rectangular garden has a perimeter of 56 meters. If the length is 4 meters more than the width, what is the area of the garden?
Sarah has a collection of coins worth $4.35. She has only quarters and dimes, and she has 24 coins in total. How many quarters does she have?
A car travels from City A to City B at 40 mph and returns at 60 mph. What is the average speed for the entire trip?
The product of two consecutive positive integers is 182. What is the sum of these two integers?
A tank can be filled by pipe A in 4 hours and by pipe B in 6 hours. If both pipes are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
Maria scored 85, 90, and 78 on her first three tests. What score does she need on her fourth test to have an average of 85?
A ladder 10 feet long leans against a wall. The bottom of the ladder is 6 feet from the wall. How high up the wall does the ladder reach?
If 40% of a number is 60, what is 75% of that number?
A baker uses 3 cups of flour for every 2 cups of sugar. If he uses 12 cups of flour, how many cups of sugar does he need?
The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:5. If there are 24 boys, how many students are in the class?
A shirt originally costs $40. It is first discounted by 20%, then the sale price is discounted by an additional 10%. What is the final price?
Two numbers have a sum of 50 and a difference of 14. What is the product of these two numbers?
A circular pool has a diameter of 14 meters. What is the circumference of the pool? Use pi = 3.14.
In a class election, candidate A got 45% of the votes, candidate B got 35%, and candidate C got the remaining votes. If there were 200 total votes, how many votes did candidate C receive?
A triangle has angles in the ratio 2:3:4. What is the measure of the largest angle?
